newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for Feb. 20.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for Feb. 20.

text.p: All major Mexican ports were reported open Thursday, the Communications and Transport Ministry said in its 1000 local/1600 GMT daily meteorological report.
The ministry said El Mezquital was shut to smaller tourism and fishing boats.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean and Pacific Coast.

Lower temperatures along the northern coastline with winds reported from 10 to 20 knots (19 to 38 km/11 to 22 miles per hour) and waves from seven to nine feet high. Clear skies and light winds along remainder of shores.
Weak cold front dropping temperatures in northwest of golf. Some clouds along rest of coast with winds from east and southeast at 10 to 20 knots and waves four to seven feet high.
Possible light rains and strong winds along coasts of Quintana Roo state and Belize. Winds from the east and southeast from about 20 to 30 km per hour.
